oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Topological insulators and K-theory
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kaufmann, Ralph M.
Li, Dan
Wehefritz-Kaufmann, Birgit
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematical Physics
Condensed Matter - Other Condensed Matter
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We analyze the topological $\mathbb{Z}_2$ invariant, which characterizes time reversal invariant topological insulators, in the framework of index theory and K-theory. The topological $\mathbb{Z}_2$ invariant counts the parity of Majorana zero modes, which can be interpreted as an analytical index. So it fits perfectly into an index theorem, and the topological index provides an efficient way to compute the topological $\mathbb{Z}_2$ invariant. Finally, the bulk-boundary correspondence gives a different perspective to view the index theorem of the topological $\mathbb{Z}_2$ invariant.
